H0.text: Wave action increases the open spaces in some aquifers composed of limestone and dolomite.

H1.text: Wind erosion increases the open spaces of aquifer formations composed of limestone and dolomite.

H2.text: Tensional faulting increases the open spaces of aquifer formations composed of limestone and dolomite.

H3.text: Chemical weathering is the process that increases the open spaces of the aquifer formation composed of limestone and dolomite.

A4.text: Carbonate dissolution on the surface of well-jointed limestone produces a dissected limestone pavement. This process is most effective along the joints, widening and deepening them.

A5.text: Dissolution (also called simple solution or congruent dissolution) is the process in which a mineral dissolves completely without producing any new solid substance.
